meanings.definition: Exceeding the real or actual; surpassing what is real or actual.
meanings.sent1: The superhero's powers were so superreal that they seemed almost magical.
meanings.sent2: The special effects in the movie created a superreal experience for the audience.
meanings.sent3: The superreal size of the cake made everyone's eyes widen in amazement.
meanings.sent4: Her superreal talent for painting brought her fame and recognition.
meanings.sent5: The superreal beauty of the sunset painted the sky in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: Something that is beyond reality; something that is more than real.
meanings.sent1: The unicorn was a superreal creature that captured the imagination of many.
meanings.sent2: The concept of time travel is often portrayed as a superreal phenomenon in science fiction.
meanings.sent3: The superreal in the story added an element of mystery and intrigue.
meanings.sent4: His dreams were filled with a superreal world where anything was possible.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting depicted a superreal landscape that seemed to come to life.
